page.title: 17 The Church
page.content: Most of the church was built in the fourteenth century with alterations and additions during the sixteenth and nineteenth centuries.It is dedicated to St. Nicholas. Until 1972 it was a Chapel of Ease to Bere Regis. Now it is part of a group of parishes called Red Post. The vicar is the Rev. Hugh Maddox. There is a parochial church council which looks after the church . Besides services on a Sunday there is a Sunday School and a Mothers Union. The church bells are not safe to ring at the moment, so money is being collected to repair them and to do other repairs around the church. The churchyard is closed and people are now buried in the new cemetery at Broadclose. We had a sponsored walk and collected Â£120 for the church.
